item.title: Lamb karahi
item.description: Adapted from this recipe Ingredients 1kg lamb kneck, on the bone 2 onions, roughly chopped half a bulb of garlic, peeled 3 green chillies 5cm piece of ginger, peeled and roughly chopped 1 tbsp ground coriander 1 tsp turmeric 1 tsp red chilli powder 1 cinnamon stick 2 black cardamom 4 green cardamom 4 cloves 200g tomatoes, chopped

item.title: Pressure cooker congee
item.description: Congee with chives, chilli oil, soy sauce and fermented cabbage Ingredients 1 cup long grain rice 9 cups water Equipment Pressure cooker Process Combine rice and water, heat in pressure cooker Once the pressure cooker reaches high pressure, cook for 20 minutes Release the pressure quickly, and take the lid off The congee will look watery. Whisk it till it reaches a consistency you like Season, add toppings (see below) Variantions I serve congee with a few toppings, usually made up from things I have in the house.

item.title: Brine fermented cabbage
item.description: Ingredients 1 head napa cabbage (Chinese cabbage) salt Equipment A plastic or glass container of jar, large enough to fit the cabbage Digital weighing scales Process Split the cabbage into quarters. I like to cut half nearest the stem with a knife, then tear the leaf half apart. Place the container on the weighing scales and tare it Put the cabbage in the container, add just enough water to cover.

item.title: Loaf tin bread
item.description: Ingredients 450g strong white flour 50g strong brown flour 10g instant yeast 10g salt 325g water Equipment Stand mixer 1kg loaf tin Process Combine ingredients in the bowl of a stand mixer Knead until the dough comes together and feels smooth, about 10 mins Add some olive oil to the bowl, and roll the dough in it to stop it drying out or sticking to the bowl Cover bowl with a tea towel and let rise until it’s doubled in size, around two hours Pour dough out onto a floured work surface, shape into a log Place log into loaf tin, seam side down Cover with a tea towel and let rise for 1 hour.
